{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3483143,"name":"0ri Korngut?","username":"Korngut","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/korngut/{size}/236083_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-15T06:50:23.569Z","cooked":"

Does anyone know if this electromagnet or that electromagnet is legal on the robot?
Or can anyone recommend a strong electromagnet that is legal?

I would also be happy if anyone knows of robots that used magnets, to send a link to them here.

Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-15T06:59:09.688Z","cooked":"

Here may be some relevant content:

Climbing Deep Cages Rules/Strategy
Just so we don’t have to rehash this argument… Magnets did not prove useful for climbing force in 2022. Make use of that info however you like.

For organizational purposes let’s keep this current thread about the legality of specific part numbers that are legal in FRC.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":24,"updated_at":"2025-01-15T06:59:09.688Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":9,"reads":639,"readers_count":638,"score":232.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":481848,"topic_slug":"electromagnet-in-frc","display_username":"Skye Leake","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/climbing-deep-cages/478557/48","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"Climbing Deep Cages","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":19235,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Pretengineer"},"post_url":"/t/electromagnet-in-frc/481848/2","custom_user_title":"Pretengineer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3},{"id":"100","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3483155,"name":"EricH","username":"EricH","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erich/{size}/128938_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-15T07:08:06.228Z","cooked":"

I’m going to apply the old “The answer is in the Manual” to the question asked: R501, last line of the table. The 24V part of that seems to refer to pneumatics control, so I would focus on the 12V electromagnet. Be prepared with documentation.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":24,"updated_at":"2025-01-15T07:08:06.228Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":608,"readers_count":607,"score":231.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":481848,"topic_slug":"electromagnet-in-frc","display_username":"EricH","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://frctools.com/2025/rule/R501","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Rule R501 | FRCTools","clicks":26}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":4212,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"#westandwithUkraine"},"post_url":"/t/electromagnet-in-frc/481848/3","custom_user_title":"#westandwithUkraine","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3483161,"name":"0ri Korngut?","username":"Korngut","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/korngut/{size}/236083_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-15T07:29:09.662Z","cooked":"

I found this law, but I want to make sure that the electromagnets I mentioned comply with the law.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":24,"updated_at":"2025-01-15T07:29:09.662Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":567,"readers_count":566,"score":143.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":481848,"topic_slug":"electromagnet-in-frc","display_username":"0ri Korngut?","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":4212,"username":"EricH","name":"EricH","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erich/{size}/128938_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60859,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6738 Co-Captain"},"post_url":"/t/electromagnet-in-frc/481848/4","custom_user_title":"6738 Co-Captain","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3483162,"name":"0ri Korngut?","username":"Korngut","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/korngut/{size}/236083_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-15T07:30:39.660Z","cooked":"

Does anyone know if using an electromagnet can interfere with motors or other electronic components?
We are afraid that this will interfere with the hall effect sensor.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":24,"updated_at":"2025-01-15T07:30:39.660Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":543,"readers_count":542,"score":148.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":481848,"topic_slug":"electromagnet-in-frc","display_username":"0ri Korngut?","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60859,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6738 Co-Captain"},"post_url":"/t/electromagnet-in-frc/481848/5","custom_user_title":"6738 Co-Captain","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3483164,"name":"EricH","username":"EricH","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erich/{size}/128938_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-15T08:01:54.880Z","cooked":"

Let me ask the question this way:

What about the rule would lead you to believe that the electromagnet would NOT comply?

Now, I don’t know what you see that makes you question whether it would or would not comply with the rules. I know I don’t see anything; I also know that I’m not the one inspecting your robot at your first event (and that person will want to see the documentation, most likely).

One other thing I’ll suggest: you may want to take a look at R504, part B. I assume you’re not going to want the magnet to be ON whenever the robot is.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":24,"updated_at":"2025-01-15T08:01:54.880Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":494,"readers_count":493,"score":108.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":481848,"topic_slug":"electromagnet-in-frc","display_username":"EricH","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://frctools.com/2025/rule/R504","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Rule R504 | FRCTools","clicks":31}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":60859,"username":"Korngut","name":"0ri Korngut?","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/korngut/{size}/236083_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":4212,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"#westandwithUkraine"},"post_url":"/t/electromagnet-in-frc/481848/6","custom_user_title":"#westandwithUkraine","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3483166,"name":"0ri Korngut?","username":"Korngut","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/korngut/{size}/236083_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-15T08:36:43.048Z","cooked":"

According to what I read in R571 there shouldn’t be a problem with the magnets I included.

Even though I didn’t find a problem, I want to make sure, because it would be very frustrating to come to the competition and not pass inspection because of this.

Therefore, I would also be interested to see if there are any groups that have used electromagnets in a robot that could point me to the magnets they used.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":24,"updated_at":"2025-01-15T08:36:43.048Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":437,"readers_count":436,"score":112.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":481848,"topic_slug":"electromagnet-in-frc","display_username":"0ri Korngut?","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://frctools.com/2025/rule/R571","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":7}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":4212,"username":"EricH","name":"EricH","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erich/{size}/128938_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60859,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6738 Co-Captain"},"post_url":"/t/electromagnet-in-frc/481848/7","custom_user_title":"6738 Co-Captain","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3483373,"name":"Nelson Green (1108 Mentor Coach Electrical Programming)","username":"ngreen","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ngreen/{size}/264478_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-15T15:11:49.581Z","cooked":"

Pretty certain we just used the strongest one we found on McMaster Carr in 2014.

IMG_20250108_1750351920×1440 220 KB

I’m sure some of the other questions are application or legality that aren’t ask clear as then.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":24,"updated_at":"2025-01-15T15:11:49.581Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":372,"readers_count":371,"score":94.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":481848,"topic_slug":"electromagnet-in-frc","display_username":"Nelson Green (1108 Mentor Coach Electrical Programming)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":2695,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/electromagnet-in-frc/481848/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3483401,"name":"philso","username":"philso","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/e68b1a/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-15T15:28:26.141Z","cooked":"

The formula for the strength of a magnetic field with respect to the current in a single wire, the distance and some other constants can be found relatively easily. You would also have to know the sensitivity of the Hall sensors you are concerned about interfering with. With this information, you should be able to determine if there may be a problem.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":24,"updated_at":"2025-01-15T15:28:26.141Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":341,"readers_count":340,"score":93.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":481848,"topic_slug":"electromagnet-in-frc","display_username":"philso","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":60859,"username":"Korngut","name":"0ri Korngut?","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/korngut/{size}/236083_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":15467,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/electromagnet-in-frc/481848/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3483463,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-15T16:27:39.981Z","cooked":"

Was this a trigger mechanism for a catapult?

If so, very cool.

(Also: Conviently ripped off part number sticker )

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":24,"updated_at":"2025-01-15T16:28:50.750Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":305,"readers_count":304,"score":126.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":481848,"topic_slug":"electromagnet-in-frc","display_username":"Skye Leake","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":2695,"username":"ngreen","name":"Nelson Green (1108 Mentor Coach Electrical Programming)","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ngreen/{size}/264478_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":19235,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Pretengineer"},"post_url":"/t/electromagnet-in-frc/481848/10","custom_user_title":"Pretengineer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3483480,"name":"Nelson Green (1108 Mentor Coach Electrical Programming)","username":"ngreen","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ngreen/{size}/264478_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-15T16:44:10.983Z","cooked":"

More a pneumatic catapult delay than a trigger. It would hold the catapult down after the solenoids opened for some short time period.

I swear I didn’t tear the sticker. I was going to grab a part number too. My best guess is this one McMaster-Carr

Awe, so it made the catapult “sticky”, this would help get around the small tube diameter /ports in FRC pneumatics that limit power delivery. Cool solution!

The wording at the bottom of Table 8-1 (Rule501) is a bit odd regarding 24V devices. Also, 24V requires the use of a boost converter of some sort. We have used the Pneumatics Control Module for this purpose to power 24V sensors but its power output is limited.

I would suggest sticking to 12Vdc rated electromagnets as there is no restriction other than using a 20A breaker and an approved controller per Rule 504.

odd regarding 24V devices

“Electrical solenoid actuators or electromagnets used at 24V must be rated for 24V.”

It does mention electromagnets though but does not specifically tell you if there are any restrictions at 24V. I would probably infer that the boost coverter has to be downstream of of a 12V, 20A breaker but …

Take what I say which a grain of salt but I don’t think it should cause problems. The hall sensors are designed to detect a magnet once it gets very close, so it is likely not very sensitive. I would still run some tests though, if it messes something up it would probably appear as a sensor fault.

Korngut:

I would be happy if someone could send a link to an electromagnet that is legal in FRC?

Someone did, very, very early in this thread. That would be YOU, in the very first post.

The requirements for a 12V electromagnet are that it’s a) 12V b) behind a 20A breaker on the PDP. That’s It. No more. No less. This is exactly what is in the rules I have been referencing.
